channel.title: Monero gui2 no display text bug
channel.description:
Hi, I was interested in using the Monero GUI client on my whonix vm but when I open it looks very odd looking and missing text. I have attached three images to show you what I mean.
https://i.imgur.com/gCGCnhg.png http://i.imgur.com/kCAf9lz.png http://i.imgur.com/4uIhAia.png

item.title: Monero gui2 no display text bug
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
jackson1:

I don’t have a standalone Debian vm available to reproduce this bug, I am just solely using the whonix vm.

Get one as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle.

Read full topic
item.source: Monero gui2 no display text bug

item.title: Monero gui2 no display text bug
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
any gui u gonna use inside whonix rather than the default kde will cause u into messy situation. thats because kde inside whonix configured and build to serve its necessity. sadly due to the low hand workers inside whonix we cannot configure and secure multiple DEs to work smoothly inside whonix. if u r willing to contribute for monero u r very welcome. (read the documentation it will help u alot to understand the work of kde inside whonix).

Read full topic
item.source: Monero gui2 no display text bug

item.title: Monero gui2 no display text bug
item.dc:creator: jackson1
item.description:
I don’t have a standalone Debian vm available to reproduce this bug, I am just solely using the whonix vm.

edit; I came across a couple reddit posts talking about the same thing and being font related so I started the gui this way and I can see text now.

QT_QPA_FONTDIR="/usr/share/fonts/truetype/freefont" ./start-gui.sh

Read full topic
item.source: Monero gui2 no display text bug
